intro: Macarthuria foliosa, commonly known as the broadleaf macarthuria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has a creeping habit with fleshy, succulent leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Macarthuria foliosa is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
